required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg Position on Fluid Responsiveness
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg Position on Fluid Responsiveness Predicted by Pulse Pressure Variation and Stroke Volume Variation During Anaesthesia for Laparoscopic Gynaecological Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The increased intraabdominal pressure and intrathoracic pressure due to pneumoperitoneum negatively affect the cardiovascular system, relatively dynamic parameters may vary due to intraoperative fluid therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: After the general anaesthesia induction and intubation, dynamic parameters such as SVV and PPV were monitored by pulse contour analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: to evaluate how stroke volume variation (%) affected during the Trendelenburg position and pneumoperitoneum
primary_outcome.description: to evaluate reliability of stroke volume variation in evaluating the response to fluid administration

primary_outcome.measure: to evaluate how pulse pressure variation (%) affected during the Trendelenburg position and pneumoperitoneum
primary_outcome.description: to evaluate reliability of pulse pressure variation in evaluating the response to fluid administration

study_pop.textblock: 45 patients over the age of 18 who would undergo elective laparoscopic gynecological surgery and had the ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) risk classification I-II were included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>18 years old patients
- Will undergo elective laparoscopic gynecological surgery
- ASA I-II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Obese patients (body mass index> 30 kg.m2)
- Patients who had arrhythmia
- Patients who had cardiac insufficiency.
